title: What is the best fitness tracker for stop-and-go running? - Quora

response.answer_text: Both my Garmin Forerunner 620 and my old Nike+ GPS watch could accomplish this - all you have to do is press "stop" when you stop at a traffic light, and then press "start" when you go back to running. It's not a perfect solution, but it seems to work well enough for me. Google Fit can apparently tell whether you are walking, running, or cycling. Perhaps this will work for you?
The MapMyRun, RunKeeper, Runtastic (paid version only) and Strava apps all have an "auto-pause" feature.
